Bob Haugen wrote:
> 
> May I suggest starting a new thread with an appropriate title to focus
> exclusively on the IANA registry issue, where each person who has a
> different position states their position clearly and succinctly, and
> thereafter we refer back to that thread as a FAQ?
> 

I've been mulling the idea of suggesting on http-wg that "discouraged"
be replaced with the normative "SHOULD NOT".  The implication would be
that HTTP implementations not using IANA would be considered, at best,
"conditionally compliant".  I assume there's some logic behind not
stigmatizing intranet HTTP implementations like that, but I'm curious
to know what it is.  Still, I think it's wrong to encourage what the
spec explicitly discourages.

-Eric
